intro: Fimbristylis mangorensis, commonly known as the Mangorensis sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland or swampy environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences that are usually green or reddish in color. Its rhizomes are fibrous and contribute to its ability to thrive in waterlogged soils. Fimbristylis mangorensis plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
